definition: to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website

sentences.english: A knight of the post bobbed a leatherhead on the street.
sentences.chinese: 一个站岗骑士在街上千了个磨碌。

sentences.english: Army that stands guard is face to outside and seems not to have a bit of suspects.
sentences.chinese: 站岗的军卫仍面朝停机坪外面，看来一点怀疑也没有。

sentences.english: The border guards are on guard.
A fireman had placed his back against a tall chimney, and seemed to be acting as sentinel.
sentences.chinese: 一个消防队员靠在高烟囱旁好象在那儿站岗。

sentences.english: If we are alert enough, we’ll notice that we are always on guard.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们足够警惕，你会发现我们经常是在站岗。

sentences.english: The platinum has Royal palace guards to stand guard before the temple.
sentences.chinese: 白金汉宫前有皇家禁卫军站岗。

sentences.english: North Korean soldier stands guard beside the Yalu River near the North Korean town of Sinuiju.
sentences.chinese: 一名朝鲜军人在朝鲜新义州附近的鸭绿江旁站岗。

sentences.english: There,as the other corners in this vicinity,a policeman was stationed.
sentences.chinese: 那儿和这一带其他角落一样，也有一胩警察站岗。

sentences.english: Riot policemen stand guard the main square of Xiahe town Gansu province March 17, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 镇暴警察在甘肃省夏河县的主要广场站岗。

sentences.english: Alone lighthouse stands guard on the Patagonia coast.
sentences.chinese: 孤独的灯塔在巴塔哥尼亚沿岸站岗。

sentences.english: Along the wall are watchtowers, where soldiers used to keep watch.
sentences.chinese: 沿着城墙，设有许多烽火台，过去的士兵用来站岗的。

sentences.english: Armed with real bronze weapons still sharp enough to draw blood, the soldiers stood guard.
sentences.chinese: 武士手持一刀见血的青铜兵器，在为其站岗。

sentences.english: Lines of police stood guard by barbed-wire barricades.
sentences.chinese: 警察列队在铁丝网路障旁站岗守卫。

sentences.english: Soon after he quietly took his post at the South Tower.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，他就开始默默地在南塔站岗。

sentences.english: Here, North Korean soldiers stand guard in Panmunjom this April.
sentences.chinese: 今年4月，北朝鲜的战士在板门店站岗。

sentences.english: A few nights later, one of these carefully selected friends was on sentry duty.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，正好是他的一个结义兄弟站岗。

definition: to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
